title: Linux Profile and Hang issues
content: I am a long time Thunderbird user on both Windows and now on Linux. My current Linux Mint system and Thunderbird are both current on updates. Thunderbird has been experiencing hang for several weeks (maybe more like a couple months) I have been living with it as it will recover if I wait a minute or so. Today when I started looking the issue I was more than a little disturbed to find the profile being used was located in mt home folder instead of on the server I had been using it on (I thought) for several years. Upon further examination it appears I have FOUR profile showing up and the one on the server has not been used in over a year. Why would my default profile not be where I expect it to be living??? I guessing I have a bunch personal folders data now scattered out across in at least three places and only one of them is getting backed up. NOT a very happy camper here today. . . See attached info: I didn't see anything in the log file, but then the hangs seem to recover when I wait them out.
creator: davedrumm41

title: Double-clicking attachments saves them to temp folder, not attachments folder
content:
I'm having the same problem referenced in this question:

[saving to private folder in Thunderbird 91.4.1]

When I double-click an attachment like a PDF, it saves into an obscure temporary folder (for example, " /private/var/folders/03/11rmmn856ndc6p50q_ffc4xm0000gn/T/pid-20977 ") rather than to the folder I've designated for saving my attachments. I want those files to save to the folder with the rest of my attachments, so I have them for non-Thunderbird reference and access. How do I get TB to actually save the files there on double-click?
creator: mattholm

title: Thunderbird 115.6.1 won't let me add a Microsoft Office 365 e-mail account.
content: The account works in Outlook and can be accessed via the Web portal but after attempting to setup the account, everything looks good until I hit Done then an error message comes up saying "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password." What is going on here. I've been able to use the same configuration in Outlook and two iOS applications.
creator: skip18

title: Thunderbird versions need to show which addons are available!
content: I have been trying to update Thunderbird from V52 for a long time., Last time I tried, the add-ons I need were randomly only available for different versions, and hardly any of them were available for the latest version. After several days trawling through finding replacement add-ons trawling through hundreds of 20 per page lists and checking each add-on's versions history for compatibility , I gave up. Is there a simpler way to do this? There used to be pages of add ons for each version, no link for that anymore that I can see. Thunderbird would be a lot more popular if updates listed addons they made incompatible. Any ideas anyone?
creator: firefox.com1

Other than deleting my mail account again, uninstalling and re-installing TB and re-adding the mail account (all these I would like to avoid if possible), I don't know what else to do. I don't even know if this would work to be honest. Help is greatly appreciated.

title: Thunderbird gmail not delivered
content:
I have a gmail account I had set up in Thunderbird in 2020 or something.It is a Google Apps set up (with my own domain) I did back when it was called google apps. It was working great, but recently, probably starting this year (2024), I am noticing some recipients don't get my mail.

They don't get my messages, I don't get any errors or failure responses. The messages are in my Gmail WEB app Sent folder, all looks like it was sent successfully, but it just doesn't get delivered.

When send the same message from Gmail web app, it gets delivered fine.

Any ideas or suggestions on further investigation are appreciated.

creator: bb20

title: Thunderbird Decription of Encrypted email fails on 115.6.1 on Mac.
content:
I've noticed using Thunderbird 115.6.1 on Mac that Thunderbird fails to decrypt an encrypted email from Postbox.

The message Thunderbird gives when I click on an encrypted email it should decrypt is: 

                        Message Security - OpenPGP 
    No Digital Signature 
    This message does not include the sender's digital signature. The     absence of a digital signature means that the message could have     been sent by someone pretending to have this email address. It is     also possible that the message has been altered while in transit     over the network. 
         Message Cannot Be Decrypted 
    There are unknown problems with this encrypted message.

--

In Postbox, the email can be decrypted as usual and other users who don't use Thunderbird tell me they have no problems decrypting the Postbox-encrypted emails, either.

I posted a message on the Enigmail forum (the encryption plug-in that Postbox still uses) but no responses thus far.

--

Sending an encrypted email from Thunderbird works fine all around.

Would appreciate some ideas on how to resolve since many of my clients use Thunderbird.

Thanks very much.
creator: firefox_acct

title: Reply messages are linked!
content:
Previous versions of TB did not chain or link replied messages to the original and were received as separate messages. So if I have a reply to a message it comes in in TB as a new received message. Now however it is linked to the original so there are "sub messages" linked under the original. How can I change that TB behavior back to the single message only? Replies get buried under multiple layers of linked messages which is often an issue even seeing a new one come in.

Tnx for anyone who may provide guidance. Searching the TB forums has not provided an answer.

Bruce Miller
creator: batsncats

title: Renamed folder and now disappeared
content:
So I have been sorting out my email folders. I am a self employed consultant and I have a casework folder with all my emails filed in sub-folders under the main casework folder under the name of the client.

In neatening this up i wanted to Capitalise every name so went to rename the folder and simply add a capital letter. But then by doing this it duplicates the folder ( I presume because it has the same name, it's just the first letter is a capital?). So I deleted the main casework folder that the system had duplicated and it has deleted all my work so I have lost 6 years of work emails.

the error message reads the current operation on 'Case' did not succeed. The mail server for account xxx responded mailbox doesn't exist. inbox.case(o.001 + 0.000 secs)

It's weird because some emails within the sub-folders are there and some not I'm trying not to panic! Thanks in advance :-)

title: Thunderbird 115.6.1 corrupting emails
content:
I have been successfully using Thunderbird for many years. In the last year or so I have been noticing that occasionally one of my sent emails gets corrupted such that the email body starts showing html text and the email subject header is changed to another email header that exists in the same folder but is unrelated to the email body. When I check the corrupted email from the Gmail web user interface, the email is not corrupted. I tried repairing the folder but to no avail.

I attach an example of a corrupted email below:

M7tGdJQYkZGPsoggrc0M6qR0--

From Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="------------NlJPhaGMpTt1f7wbEHlOvxNE" Message-ID: <4bf83075-b571-4214-921b-09f4582e6e58@jesuit.org.mt> Date: Thu, 4 Jan 2024 10:25:56 +0100 MIME-Version: 1.0 User-Agent: Mozilla Thunderbird Subject: Re: Minutes of SCPC Meeting Content-Language: en-GB To: Charlotte Attard <charlotte.attard@staloysius.edu.mt> References: <AM9PR10MB487111674D307583B8DB6AD3D195A@AM9PR10MB4871.EURPRD10.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM> <AM9PR10MB487106F96E9E404BDA477808D167A@AM9PR10MB4871.EURPRD10.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM> From: Stephen Scerri <stephen.scerri@jesuit.org.mt> In-Reply-To: <AM9PR10MB487106F96E9E404BDA477808D167A@AM9PR10MB4871.EURPRD10.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM>

NlJPhaGMpTt1f7wbEHlOvxNE

My searches have come up with various responses for an IMAP setup but I haven't been able to find anything for my POP setup. Could someone help me with this please?
creator: dobrphi

title: Thunderbird 115 Garbling Messages
content:
In the last month or two, Thunderbird has been intermittently garbling messages. Some of them look like content that was not decrypted, but others have message content from other messages in the body. I found a similar post for this issue in Thunderbird 102, but it has been archived without a solution confirmed.

I just upgraded from 115.5.1 to 115.6.1. This did not fix the garbled messages, but I cannot yet report if new messages are being garbled. I also disabled all themes and extensions (although troubleshooting info shows others not manageable in "Manage Your Extensions") when this began happening. I am connecting to IMAP servers managed by Google, and I am on Windows 11 Home. The garbled content happens always with messages originating from Basecamp, although the mishmash of messages fuses content from Basecamp messages with messages from other senders such as Blackbaud.

The message content remains in tact on Google Mail in the web browser interface. Moving the message from the inbox to another folder via the web browser interface and then moving it back to the inbox via the same interface restores the content.

I cannot provide a full example because of the potential to expose confidential information in content that might be decoded by someone else, but attached is a partial example of what I see. Note the subject in the list view versus the lack of subject in the message header and the completely different subject in the message body.

creator: database103

title: RETR errors since January 10 upgrade
content: In Thunderbird I keep getting RETR errors, and I am unable to get out of troubleshoot mode. No solutions to either problem appear. I can only access my principle email through Comcast.
creator: petercnslt

title: Cant get inbound email
content: cannot download new email getting msg: The RETR command did not succeed. Error retrieving a message. Mail server mail.comcast.net responded: Message 18 expunged.
creator: geotrac

title: My Email through Outlook stopped working
content: I am using Office 365 for my email through my domain on thunderbird. It worked for a year but all of a sudden, I could no longer send emails through thunderbird. I tried deleting the email account and readding the email account but the autoconfiguration wizard could no longer detect my setting for the email account. I then looked at the configuration setting through my provider and everything is correct including password. I am able to login through my webmail using the same password. I keep getting an error login failed using username combination error on thunderbird. I've talked to my email provider support, and everything is up and working on their end. I have tried disabling a deleting all my add-ons on thunderbird as well as restarting and reinstalling. I have no idea what happened and why it stopped working all of a sudden. I am using Thunderbird Version 115.6.1
creator: tnh4mdh5qr

title: Thunderbird Email client installation on a Kubuntu Ver. 22.04 LTS
content: I have downloaded the file:///home/stevieb/Downloads/thunderbird-115.6.1.tar.bz2 . Now how do i get this package installed correctly?
creator: s.patterson

title: Error message when trying to send email to new addresss
content:
I just received the first message exchanged between me and my new lawyer. I tried to reply to it and got a strange error message. Enclosed is a screen shot.

I have used Thunderbird for years and never had this problem. This is the first time.

I sent my reply through my Gmail account and it went through, so something is going on with Thunderbird. It does not like "ryan@bainlaw.net" and "fairan@bainlaw.net".

I do not have any filters set up.
creator: rspung0711

title: New email changes for Yahoo and Google
content:
Verify your email domain and set up DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM)

We've set up in-app guidance and instructions on the Domains page of your account to both verify and authenticate your domain through DKIM. Additionally, these help resources explain the processes in detail: Verify your domain and How to set up email domain authentication

Set up Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)

You can set up DMARC authentication for your sending domain in your DNS provider yourself. Your DMARC enforcement policy should be set to none, and Google has some guidelines to set your brand up for success.
creator: store14

title: edit the "recent" list Thunderbird
content: Clearing the "Recent" list when attempting to move emails used to be simple. Go to your profile while Thunderbird is NOT running and delete the panacea.dat file. It's no longer there. The only threads in the support forum suggest the same thing, but the threads are EIGHT years old. Where is the list of entries for the "Recents" folder located and how do I reset it. I have more than 20 entries, most of which I've used only ONCE. How to I clear this mess?
creator: jkenning

title: Unable to send email from Mozilla Thunderbird
content: Unable to send email from Mozilla Thunderbird Problem has been worked over days, good ideas have come in via this portal, all workable ones did not change the fact: email can not be sent Our server: acsalaska.net after contacting, went over our account, all is well on their end, it must then be Mozilla Thunderbird that holds the key Thanks for your input
creator: alaskawill

title: Unable to send email from Mozilla Thunderbird
content:
Willie Suter Willie Suter Today at 1:15 PM

Unable to send email from Mozilla Thunderbird Problem has been worked over days, good ideas have come in via this portal, all workable ones did not change the fact: email can not be sent Our server: acsalaska.net after contacting, went over our account, all is well on their end, it must then be Mozilla Thunderbird that holds the key Thanks for your input
creator: alaskawill

title: completely removing all vestiges of Thunderbird from computer and starting afresh
content:
I think I have a corrupt profile in Thunderbird. I would like to totally wipe the installation from my computer and start over.

When I uninstall using the built-in installer in Windows apps, some of the features are removed, but apparently not all, because when I re-download and reinstall, my old emails pop right back up. That tells me that info. about that installation is still lurking on my computer somewhere. I want a completely fresh installation that requires me to recreate my Thunderbird profile, etc. and requires me to re-link Thunderbird to my G-mail account.

Is there a way to accomplish this erasure?

Thanks a mil.

GAS
creator: gstring1940
